meanings.definition: A heading or title that comes after the main heading or title.
meanings.sent1: The subheading of the article provided more details about the topic.
meanings.sent2: The report had a clear subheading that summarized the content below.
meanings.sent3: The subheading seemed to have a mind of its own, jumping out from the page.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a subheading in the story of his life, bright and captivating.
meanings.sent5: The subheading acted as a guide, leading the reader through the text smoothly.

meanings.definition: A smaller heading within a larger section of text.
meanings.sent1: The subheading highlighted the key point in the paragraph.
meanings.sent2: Each subheading in the document helped organize the information effectively.
meanings.sent3: The subheading whispered secrets to the words around it, creating intrigue.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed like a subheading, breaking the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The subheading stood out like a beacon, drawing attention to the important details.
